When you go into outer space, you are in a vacuum. Everything is black and you can see starts off into the distance. There is no atmosphere, this is what most people think of when they here the word nothing; this is not what I mean. In a vacuum, there is still space-time, quantum fluctuations, spatial dimensions, forces such as gravity. Before the big bang, there was none of this. I would also like to clarify what dimensions are. The amount of dimensions = the amount of coordinates you need to specify a unique point in space.  The picture above illustrates spatial dimensions, our universe only has three of these (as far as we know). Before the big bang, there was none of this. Even asking what it looked like before the big bang is meaningless because there was nothing there to look at, no space for anything to exist in.
